titleText.ttltext: Treatment of cutaneous pseudolymphoma: A @hit_startsystematic review@hit_end

paras: Cutaneous pseudolymphoma (CPL) is a reactive po-lyclonal T- or B-cell lymphoproliferative process. CPL may appear as localized or disseminated skin lesions. While most cases of CPL are idiopathic, they may also occur as a response to, for example, contact dermatitis, arthropod reactions, and bacterial infections. CPL can be classified based on its clinical features, but all variants have similar histopathological patterns of either predominantly B-cell infiltrates, T-cell infiltrates, or mixed T/B-cell infiltrates. The prognosis of CPL is good, but the underlying disease process should be taken into account. If an antigenic stimulus is identified, it should be removed. In patients with idiopathic CPL, a close follow-up control strategy should be adopted. The aim of this @hit_startsystematic review@hit_end is to summarize all reported treatments for CPL. The review was based on articles from the @hit_startPubMed@hit_end database, using the query “skin pseudolymphoma treatment”, English and German, about “human” subjects, and published between 1990 and 2015 documenting adequate treatment and/ or aetiology. Mainly individual case reports and small case series were found. Treatment options include topical and intralesional agents, systemic agents, and physical modalities. The final part of the review proposes a treatment algorithm for CPL according to each aetiology, based on the literature of the last 25 years. Future research should focus on randomized controlled trials and studies on long-term outcomes, which were not identified in the current review.

titleText.ttltext: Malaria @hit_startvaccine@hit_end development: The need for novel approaches: A review article

organizations: Center for Research of Endemic Parasites of Iran (CREPI), Tehran University of Medical Sciences

abstracts.publisherCopyright: © 2018, Tehran University of Medical Sciences (TUMS). All rights reserved.
paras: Background: Although rigorous efforts have substantially decreased the malaria burden through decades, it still threatens the lives of millions of children. Development of an effective @hit_startvaccine@hit_end can provide important approach in malaria control strategies. Unfortunately, development of an effective @hit_startvaccine@hit_end for falciparum malaria has been hindered by the extreme complexity of malaria parasite biology, complex and diverse parasite genomes, and immune evasion by the parasites as well as the intricate nature of the parasites infection cycle. The aim of this review was to discuss the different approaches to malaria @hit_startvaccine@hit_end development until now. Methods: Scientific databases, including @hit_startMEDLINE@hit_end (via @hit_startPubMed@hit_end) and SCOPUS were searched up to 30 Jan 2017 and the articles regarding malaria @hit_startvaccine@hit_end development were taken into examination. Results: Several strategies for malaria @hit_startvaccine@hit_end development including preerythrocytic @hit_startvaccines@hit_end, antibody-based subunit @hit_startvaccines@hit_end, vectored @hit_startvaccines@hit_end, whole sporozoite @hit_startvaccines@hit_end, genetically Attenuated parasites and sporozoite subunit @hit_startvaccine@hit_end, erythrocytic @hit_startvaccines@hit_end, sexual stage @hit_startvaccine@hit_end, transmission-blocking @hit_startvaccine@hit_end as well as synthetic peptides and conjugate @hit_startvaccine@hit_end has been introduced. However, the success has been limited thus far. Conclusion: Although development of malaria @hit_startvaccine@hit_end over the past 70 year has been continued, the discovery, development, and licensing of a malaria @hit_startvaccine@hit_end formulation, which meets safety, affordability, accessibility, applicability, and efficacy has not yet been achieved.

titleText.ttltext: Temozolomide chemotherapy in newly-diagnosed adult glioblastoma: A @hit_startsystematic review@hit_end using a computational evidence aggregation technique

paras: INTRODUCTION: Standard treatment for newly-diagnosed glioblastoma in adults consists of maximal surgical resection, followed by radiotherapy with concurrent and adjuvant temozolomide. Many trials have attempted to improve on this regimen. Conventional methods of @hit_startmetaanalysis@hit_end are limited by problems with lack of transparency and interactivity. We conducted a @hit_startsystematic review@hit_end using a novel computational method to synthesise and explore the robustness of evidence for new treatment options. METHOD: We identified all randomised controlled trials in newly-diagnosed adult glioblastoma which included temozolomide in at least one treatment arm. We excluded trials conducted exclusively in the elderly. We extracted data on treatment, overall survival, progression-free survival and toxicities, and assessed the quality of evidence using GRADE criteria. We used a computational evidence aggregation technique to summarise the results in a graphical treatment network. This shows which treatments are superior, the evidence supporting that assessment, and the effect of applying different subjective preference criteria regarding the relative importance of various outcome measures in defining superiority. RESULTS: We @hit_startanalysed@hit_end data from 24 trials (4756 patients). There is robust evidence supporting the use of standard chemoradiotherapy (7 trials). We identify four additional treatment regimens which may confer a survival advantage: 1) addition of tumour-treating fields, 2) addition of bevacizumab, 3) addition of induction temozolomide, and 4) addition of dendritic cell @hit_startvaccine@hit_end. However, the evidence for three of these has significant weaknesses. CONCLUSION: Our computational evidence aggregation technique shows patterns of hierarchical superiority in temozolomide chemotherapy regimens for newly-diagnosed glioblastoma in adults. We identify several treatment regimens which may be superior to standard chemoradiotherapy. The best supported option is the addition of tumour-treating fields. In addition, we provide a novel graphical method for reviewing the evidence base. This allows clear visualisation of the available evidence, both for understanding the current evidence and planning future trials.

titleText.ttltext: Prevalence of human papillomavirus genotypes and relative risk of cervical cancer in China: A @hit_startsystematic review@hit_end and @hit_startmetaanalysis@hit_end

organizations: Department of Gynecology and Obstetrics, Taizhou Hospital of Zhejiang Province, Wenzhou Medical University

paras: High-risk HPV (hrHPV) is related to cervical carcinogenesis, although clinical data comparing the natural history and carcinogenic potential of type-specific HPV remain limited. Furthermore, the nationwide prevalence rates of overall and typespecific HPV among women with cervical precancerous lesions and cancer have not been reported. Here, a @hit_startmeta@hit_end@hit_start-analysis@hit_end was performed for type-specific HPV distribution among 30,165 HPV-positive women, including 12,094 invasive cervical cancers (ICCs), 10,026 cervical intraepithelial neoplasia grade 2/3 (CIN2/3), 3246 CIN1, and 4799 normal cervices from 45 PCR-based studies. We found that HPV16 was the most common hrHPV type involved in cervical disease. The HPV16 positivity rate varied little across normal (22.7%) and CIN1 individuals (23.6%) but increased through the CIN2 (37.6%) and CIN3 patients (51.9%) to 65.6% in ICC cases. HPV16, 18, 35, 39, 45, and 59 were more frequent in ICC than CIN3, with ICC:CIN3 ratios ranging from 2.3 for HPV18 to 1.1 for HPV35/45. HPV31, 33, 52, and 58 were more frequent in CIN3 compared with normal cervices but less common in ICC compared with CIN3 (ICC:CIN3 ratios ranging from 0.6 for HPV58 and 0.4 for HPV52). The ICC:normal ratios were particularly high for HPV18, 52 and 58 in West China (4.1, 3.9 and 2.9, respectively) and for HPV45 and 59 in North China (1.6 and 1.1, respectively). In summary, this study is the most comprehensive @hit_startanalysis@hit_end of type-specific HPV distribution in cervical carcinogenesis and could be valuable for HPV-based cervical cancer screening strategies and @hit_startvaccination@hit_end policies in China.

titleText.ttltext: Effect of probiotics and prebiotics on immune response to influenza @hit_startvaccination@hit_end in adults: A @hit_startsystematic review@hit_end and @hit_startmeta@hit_end@hit_start-analysis@hit_end of randomized controlled trials

organizations: Division of Allergy,Immunology,Rheumatology Disease, Department of Pediatrics, Mackay Memorial Hospital

paras: RATIONALE: To summarize the evidence from RCTs to investigate the effect of probiotics / prebiotics on the immune response of adult accept influenza @hit_startvaccination@hit_end. METHODS: Databases were searched from inception to July 2017. We used @hit_startCochrane@hit_end Review risk-of-bias assessment tools of RCT for quality assessment. Our objective is seroprotection and seroconversion rate of the influenza @hit_startvaccination@hit_end influenced by probiotics / prebiotics. RESULTS: A total of 20 RCTs comprising 1,979 adults were included in our @hit_startsystematic review@hit_end. Nine RCTs including 623 participants were pooled through a @hit_startmeta@hit_end@hit_start-analysis@hit_end. Participants who take probiotics / prebiotics showed a significant improvement in H1N1 seroprotection rate(OR51.83, 95% CI 1.19 - 2.82, p50.006, I250%), in H3N2 seroprotection rate(OR5 2.85, 95% CI 1.59 -5.10, p<0.001, I250%) and in B strain seroconversion rate(OR5 2.11, 95% CI 1.38 - 3.21, p<0.001, I250%). In subgroup @hit_startanalysis@hit_end according to intervention type, participants using probiotics had a significant better seroconversion rate in H3N2(OR53.52, 95% CI 1.45 - 8.53, p5 0.005, I25 63%). @hit_startMeta@hit_end-regression disclosed the effect of probiotics / prebiotics was significantly positive correlated with the duration of supplementson seroconversion rate for influenza B strain and seroconversion rate for influenza H1N1 strain. Subgroup @hit_startanalysis@hit_end also showed that health elders supplemented with probiotics / prebiotics exhibited significant better response to all of the influenza strains than health adults and unhealthy elders. CONCLUSIONS: This @hit_startmeta@hit_end@hit_start-analysis@hit_end suggests that probiotics / prebiotics is effective to elevate the immunogenicity of seroconversion and seroprotection rate for adults inoculated with influenza @hit_startvaccine@hit_end, especially the health elders and longer treatment duration.

sourceTitle: Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology

titleText.ttltext: Implementing a protocol for intravenous polyvalent immunoglobulins use in a neonatal unit

organizations: Pharmacy, Hôpitaux Universitaires Paris Centre-Hôpital Cochin

paras: Background and Objective: Neonatal allo-immune thrombopenia is due to an incompatibility of maternal and foetal platelet types. Without early treatment, intracranial haemorrhage is the most serious side-effect of thrombopenia. Several studies show the efficacy of intravenous human polyvalent immunoglobulins (IVIg) when administered in the first days of life. These blood derivatives must be subjected to a controlled prescription, especially in an off-label use. Our objective is to secure IVIg's prescription and administration, in a neonatology ward. Design: A @hit_startliterature review@hit_end was realized via @hit_startPubMed@hit_end with keywords including “foetomaternal platelets”, “allo-@hit_startimmunization@hit_end” and “neonatal thrombopenia”. We asked paediatricians to determine a platelet threshold to administer IVIg, and to choose the appropriate IVIg's brand name for neonates depending on concentration and excipients. We also discussed with pharmacist in charge of blood derivatives about the prescription and traceability modalities, as well as the required scientific justification. We have prefilled the supporting prescription record, in order to facilitate prescriptions in emergency situations. We asked a referent nurse to evaluate the administration form. Results: @hit_startLiterature review@hit_end allowed determining an IVIg dosage of 1 g/kg/d, renewable after 24 h if needed. A new regimen could be proposed after 3 weeks. In case of circulatory bad tolerance, posology may be reduced to 0,4 g/kg/d during 5 days. The platelet threshold was set to 50 9 10@sup_begin9@sup_end/L. The prefilled off-label prescription record includes indication, name and dosage of chosen IVIg, bibliographic references, and the whished efficacy threshold. Paediatricians fill in the form with clinical details of the patient and keep a copy in patient record. Administration record was made as a checklist (as transfusion administration records). It allows checking patient identity, drugs' conformity. A pre-completed infusion rate table is included, allowing to simply calculate hourly debit depending on patient weight. Finally, it indicates needed surveillance, and its frequency, to check infusion tolerance. Conclusion: By simplifying the physician's prescription and pro-viding to nurses a help for medicines administration, this work contributed to secure IVIg use in neonatology. This approach should be implemented for all drugs needing a particular surveillance, considering extreme fragility of patients in this ward.

titleText.ttltext: Indirect rotavirus @hit_startvaccine@hit_end effectiveness for the prevention of rotavirus hospitalization: A @hit_startsystematic review@hit_end and @hit_startmeta@hit_end@hit_start-analysis@hit_end

organizations: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation, University of Washington

abstracts.publisherCopyright: © 2018 by The American Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene.
paras: Two rotavirus @hit_startvaccines@hit_end, RotaTeq and Rotarix, are licensed for global use; however, the protection they confer to unvaccinated individuals through indirect effects remains unknown. We @hit_startsystematically reviewed@hit_end the @hit_startliterature@hit_end and quantified indirect rotavirus @hit_startvaccine@hit_end effectiveness (VE) for preventing rotavirus hospitalization in children aged less than 5 years. From 148 identified abstracts, 14 studies met our eligibility criteria. In our main @hit_startanalysis@hit_end using a randomeffects model, indirect rotavirus VE was 48% (95% confidence interval [CI]: 39-55%). In a subgroup @hit_startanalysis@hit_end by country income level, indirect VE was greater in high-income countries (52%; 95% CI: 43-60%) than in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs) (25%; 95% CI: 5-41%). In a sensitivity @hit_startanalysis@hit_end using a quality-effects model, the indirect VE in LMICs was not statistically significant (25%; 95% CI: 0-44%). Our findings highlight the importance of increasing rotavirus @hit_startvaccine@hit_end coverage, particularly in LMICs where evidence for indirect VE is limited and rotavirus burden is high.

sourceTitle: American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene

titleText.ttltext: Relapse-free survival as a surrogate for overall survival in the evaluation of stage II-III melanoma adjuvant therapy

organizations: European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer Headquarters

paras: Background: We assessed whether relapse-free survival (RFS; time until recurrence/death) is a valid surrogate for overall survival (OS) among resected stage II-III melanoma patients through a @hit_startmeta@hit_end@hit_start-analysis@hit_end of randomized controlled trials. Methods: Individual patient data (IPD) on RFS and OS were collected from 5826 patients enrolled in 11 randomized adjuvant trials comparing interferon (IFN) to observation. In addition, IPD from two studies comparing IFN and @hit_startvaccination@hit_end in 989 patients were included. A two-level modeling approach was used for assessing Spearman's patient-level correlation (rho) of RFS and OS and the trial-level coefficient of determination (R@sup_begin2@sup_end) of the treatment effects on RFS and on OS. The results were validated externally in 13 adjuvant studies without available IPD. We then tested the results on the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) 18071 double-blind trial comparing ipilimumab 10mg/kg with placebo, which showed a statistically significant impact of the checkpoint inhibitor on RFS and OS. All statistical tests were two-sided. Results: With a median follow-up of seven years, 12 of 13 trials showed a consistency between the IFN vs No IFN differences regarding RFS (hazard ratio [HR]@sub_beginRFS@sub_end = 0.88) and OS (HR@sub_beginOS@sub_end = 0.91), but the small trial, Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group 2696, was an outlier (HR@sub_beginRFS@sub_end = 0.72 vs HR@sub_beginOS@sub_end = 1.11). Therefore, even if rho was high, R@sup_begin2@sup_end was low and could not reliably be estimated. Based on the 12 trials, rho remained high (0.89), and the hazard ratios for RFS and OS were strongly correlated (R@sup_begin2@sup_end = 0.91). The surrogate threshold effect for RFS was estimated to be 0.77. For the EORTC 18071 trial, the hazard ratio for RFS was 0.75, predicting an effect of ipilimumab on OS. This was subsequently confirmed (HR@sub_beginOS@sub_end = 0.72, 95.1% confidence interval = 0.58 to 0.88, P = .001). Conclusions: In high-risk stage II-III melanoma, RFS appeared to be a valid surrogate end point for OS for adjuvant randomized studies assessing interferon or a checkpoint inhibitor. In future similar adjuvant studies, a hazard ratio for RFS of 0.77 or less would predict a treatment impact on OS.

sourceTitle: Journal of the National Cancer Institute

titleText.ttltext: The economic evaluation in @hit_startvaccines - a systematic review@hit_end in Vietnam situation

organizations: Department of Social, Economic and Administrative Pharmacy, Faculty of Pharmacy, Mahidol University

abstracts.publisherCopyright: © 2016 EManuscript, C/o Phcog.Net. All Rights Reserved.
paras: Background: Along with economic crisis, the budget for research is also affected. @hit_startSystematic review@hit_end of outcome measurement instrument is a method for choosing researches and articles for our research and practice. It provides evidences to make sure that our research will useful. Besides that, economic evaluation is a new approach to help policy maker giving affordable decision to invest in health sector. Our purpose was defined and summarize the status of economic evaluations of @hit_startvaccines@hit_end and to find out the new trend in economic evaluation of @hit_startvaccines@hit_end in the future in Vietnam. Method: A systematic literature search was conducted in some database such as @hit_startMEDLINE@hit_end, SCOPUS, COCHRANCE and GOOGLE SCHOLAR between May 26th, 2016 and June 16th, 2016. The quality of reviews was assessed by using a specific checklist. Abstracts and titles are read firstly to eliminate articles are not related with our topic. Results: A total of six articles were included. These articles focus on three @hit_startvaccines@hit_end: rotavirus, typhoid VI and human papillomavirus @hit_startvaccine@hit_end. In there, only rotavirus @hit_startvaccine@hit_end is cost-effectiveness. The target population is children and women. These articles using mathematic model based on decision tree and Markov model are the method to approach. Conclusion: Economic evaluation is a new area in Vietnam, it need to pay attention to research and develop to control the investment effectively. It is important to be aware of methodology and interpretation of results because of affecting to decision of policy maker and also affecting in national expanded program in @hit_startimmunization@hit_end on adding new good @hit_startvaccines@hit_end.
